intro: Threlkeldia, commonly known as the bluebell of the genus Threlkeldia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often blooming in late spring. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and is found in parts of eastern North America. Threlkeldia species are perennial herbs with lance-shaped leaves and a preference for moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a native wildflower and its ecological importance to pollinators.
